reasoning: Pigment dispersion syndrome is a well-defined ophthalmological condition with prevalence estimates of 1-2% of the population from population-based eye surveys. Reported as prevalence since it is a chronic condition with variable age of onset and no clear 'incidence' metric.
source: Allingham RR et al. Shields' Textbook of Glaucoma (6th ed., 2011); Ritch R, Schl√∂tzer-Schrehardt U. Exfoliation syndrome. Surv Ophthalmol. 2001;45(3):265-315
